tweezer.physics.electrostatics module¶

tweezer.physics.electrostatics.bjerrum_length(temperature=298, units='pN nm')[source]¶

Separation at which the electrostatic interaction between two elementary charges is comparable in magnitude to the thermal energy.

Parameters:

temperature : float

Temperature in units of [K] Default: 298 K
Returns:

length : float

Bjerrum length

tweezer.physics.hydrodynamics module¶

Bases: builtins.object

class tweezer.physics.hydrodynamics.TemperatureDependentViscosity[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

Bases: builtins.object

tweezer.physics.hydrodynamics.drag_on_sphere(radius=1000, dynamicViscosity=9e-10, verbose=False)[source]¶

Calculates the simple Stokes’ drag coefficient of a sphere in a Newtonian fluid at low Reynolds number.

Parameters:

radius : float

Radius of solid sphere in [nm] Default: 1000 nm

dynamicViscosity : float

Dynamic viscosity in [pN/nm^2 s] Default: 0.9e-9 pN/nm^s s

verbose : bool

Print parameters and results with units Default: False
Returns:

dragCoefficient : float

Stokes drag coefficient in [pN/nm s]

tweezer.physics.thermodynamics module¶

tweezer.physics.thermodynamics.thermal_energy(temperature=298, units='pN nm')[source]¶

Thermal energy in units of [pN nm]

Parameters:

temperature : float

Temperature in units of [K] Default: 298 K

units : str

Unit of the returned energy value Choices: ‘pN nm’, ‘J’, None Default: ‘pN nm’
Returns:

energy : float

Thermal energy in [units] (default is [pN nm])

tweezer.physics.viscosity module¶

Calculate viscosity of water-glycerol mixtures according to [Cheng](http://www3.ntu.edu.sg/home/cnscheng/Publications/reprint/Glycerin- water%20viscosity%20paper%20_sent%20to%20Ind%20Eng%20Chem%20Res.pdf)

The following variables are used:

Temperature T: [0, 100] in [C]

tweezer.physics.viscosity.calc_alpha(glycerolMassFraction, temperature=25)[source]¶

Calculates alpha, the exponent used in the power law of the dynamic viscosity calculation

Parameters:
  • glycerolMassFraction – Cm in the range [0, 1]
  • temperature – in Celsius in the range [0, 100]
Return alpha:

power law exponent
tweezer.physics.viscosity.calc_coef_a(temperature=25)[source]¶

Coefficient a for temperature dependence of alpha

Parameters:temperature – in Celsius in the range [0, 100]
Return coefA:coefficient A

Coefficient b for temperature dependence of alpha

  • coefA – Coefficient A
Return coefB:

coefficient B
tweezer.physics.viscosity.calc_density_of_mixture(waterVolume, glycerolVolume, temperature=25)[source]¶

Calculates the density of a glycerol-water mixture from an interpolation by Cheng (see viscosity docstring for reference.)

Parameters:parameter – Description
Return name:Description
tweezer.physics.viscosity.calc_glycerol_fraction_by_mass(waterVolume, glycerolVolume, temperature)[source]¶

Calculates the mass fraction of glycerol in a water - glycerol mixture

Parameters:
  • waterVolume – volume of water in l
  • glycerolVolume – volume of glycerol in l
  • temperature – in Celsius in the range [0, 100]
Return massFractionGlycerol:
 

Fraction of glycerol by mass in [0, 1]

tweezer.physics.viscosity.dynamic_viscosity_of_mixture(waterVolume=1, glycerolVolume=0, temperature=25)[source]¶

Power law equation for the dynamic viscosity of a water to glycerol mixture according to:

mu = mu_{w}^{lpha} mu_{g}^{1 - lpha}

tweezer.physics.viscosity.glycerol_density(temperature)[source]¶

Calculates the density of glycerol from an interpolation by Cheng (see viscosity docstring for reference.)

Parameters:temperature – in Celsius in the range [0, 100]
Return glycerolDensity:
 Density of Glycerol in kg/m^3
tweezer.physics.viscosity.glycerol_dynamic_viscosity(temperature=25)[source]¶

Calculates mu_g, the dynamic viscosity of glycerol using the interpolation formula of Cheng

Parameters:temperature – in Celsius in the range [0, 100]
Return glycerolDynamicViscosity:
 Dynamic viscosity of glycerol in [0.001 N s / m^2]
